results.title: Origin of the motion picture
results.brief_description: An historical record of the development of the machinery and arts of the motion picture, from the earliest suggestions of Leonardo da Vinci to the perfected sound motion picture of Edison. Scenes as early as 1880 are included and reference is made to the work of Plateau, Daguerre, Muybridge, Marey, Edison, Armat, Dickson and others.

results.title: Orienteering: family, fun and fitness
results.brief_description: Explains what is involved in the sport of orienteering. The film shows the organisation and running of a large international orienteering competition. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Orienteering
results.brief_description: Explains the sport of orienteering in which contestants must travel a course as quickly as possible, choosing the routes by map and compass. Shows scenes from the first Canadian orienteering championship in Guelph, Ontario. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Orientations: Chris Doyle: stirred not shaken
results.creator_credit: Rick Farquharson, Karena Slaninka, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Pagan Films
results.brief_description: Orientations offers a broad profile of Australian maverick cinematographer Chris Doyle, whose collaborations with Hong Kong director Wong Kar-Wai have elevated him into cult status. Energetic to the point of being manic, Doyle talks candidly about his unorthodox working relationship with Kar-Wai, discussing how they shape the films through minimal scripting, their experiments with lighting and film stock, and the many “happy accidents” that contributes to their distinct look. With no formal training behind him and a working method which can only be described as chaotic, Doyle has ironically become hot property in Hollywood, whose formal and rigid studio system seems to be the antithesis of Doyle’s haphazard shooting methods. None the less, he has lensed films for high profile American directors such as Gus Van Sant (Psycho) and Barry Levinson (Liberty Heights). The documentary also focuses on Doyle’s directing debut, “Away with words”, which premiered at the 1999 Cannes film festival and his numerous side projects as a photographer and collage artist. See also “Fallen Angels” (1995), “Ashes of time” (1994), “Happy together” (1997).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rick Farquharson, Karena Slaninka, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Pagan Films

results.title: Orientation of the camera
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Looks at the relationship of the viewer to the screen, and the way in which attention is absorbed into the world of the filmmaker, affecting the viewer’s own orientation. Notes also the physical support of the camera and its orientation in space.

results.title: Oriental brushwork
results.creator_credit: Eliot O'Hara and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents a historical sketch of Chinese art, emphasising the purity and restraint of Chinese brushwork and explaining that oriental artists seek to convey mood and emotion rather than a literal representation. Features paintings from the Freer Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C. Narrated by Eliot O’Hara.

results.title: Oriana
results.brief_description: The building of the P&O Orient liner ‘Oriana’. Follows the birth of the ship from the early design stages and the testing of models to the actual building at the Barrow-in-Furness shipyards. Extensive use of prefabricated units is a feature of construction, and attention is paid to interior decoration and fitments. Launching and acceptance trials are also seen. Narrated by Maurice Denham.

results.title: Organization
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Enterprise”.
Lew Kraft, a successful and dynamic businessman, who is building a large shopping centre, opens up the intriguing and complex world of high finance and organisational know-how. The film then traces American economics from 18th century examples of community and farm organisation, through the complexity of the industrial and transportation revolutions, to modern-day international investments and multinational corporations and the organisational knack of Americans. With William Shatner.

results.title: Organism
results.brief_description: A visual study of urbanisation, in which the structure of cities is compared to living tissue. Traffic arteries are seen as the bloodstream circulating through the urban body and its skyscrapers are seen as the skeletal structure.
